popt4jlib.MSSC1D

Class Solver

  • java.lang.Object
    • popt4jlib.MSSC1D.Solver

  • public class Solver
extends java.lang.Object
    Solver class implements methods based on Dynamic Programming to solve the problem of clustering a sequence of numbers among k clusters. Both serial and parallel versions are provided. The solveXXXMat() methods are the fastest as they are based on the native matrix representations of clusters instead of using Cluster and ClusterSet objects.

    Title: popt4jlib

    Description: A Parallel Meta-Heuristic Optimization Library in Java

    Copyright: Copyright (c) 2011

    Company:

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Ioannis T. Christou

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      double getIncumbentValue()
      return the optimal MSSC1D value computed.
      int getNumIters()
      return the total number of iterations.
      double[] getSolutionClusterSmallestValuesSortedAsc()
      for each of the clusters obtained, keep the smallest value in the cluster and add them in non-descending order in the result.
      java.util.List getSolutionIndices()
      return a List<Integer> where result[i] is a number in [1...k] indicating to which cluster the i-th original element belongs to.
      ClusterSet getSolutionSortedIndices()
      return the solution cluster indices of the sorted array sequence as a ClusterSet object.
      ClusterSet getSolutionWOrigIndices()
      return the solution cluster indices of the original array sequence as a ClusterSet object.
      static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
      test the cost-matrix creation for the L2 norm.
      private ClusterSet makeAllClusters()
      has same purpose as makeAllClustersMatrix(p), but uses Cluster and ClusterSet objects which it returns.
      private double[][] makeAllClustersMatrix_L2(Params p)
      return the matrix of dimensions n X n where [i,j] denotes the cost of the cluster containing the contiguous values of indices [i, i+1, ..., j] computed for L2 norm, only, allowing the overall MSSC1D DP-algorithm based on DP to achieve complexity O(kn^2/E) where k is the number of clusters sought and E the number of available processing units.
      private double[][] makeAllClustersMatrix(Params p)
      return the matrix of dimensions n X n where [i,j] denotes the cost of the cluster containing the contiguous values of indices [i, i+1, ..., j].
      double solveDP()
      solve the 1-D clustering problem (using Cluster and ClusterSet objects).
      double solveDP2()
      this method is the same as solveDP() except the (i,k) loop runs vertically instead of horizontally so that memory is saved Thus the outer loop is k, the inner loop is i
      double solveDP2Parallel(int numthreads)
      this method is the same as solveDP2() except we use numthreads threads to run the inner vertical loop for the i=n-2...0 computing the k-th column values.
      double solveDP2ParallelMat(int numthreads)
      this method is the same as solveDP2Parallel() using numthreads threads to run the inner vertical loop for the i=n-2...0 computing the k-th column values.
      double solveDPMat()
      this method is the same as solveDP() except it doesn't use ClusterSets.

    • Method Detail

      • solveDP

        public double solveDP()
               throws CException
        solve the 1-D clustering problem (using Cluster and ClusterSet objects).
        Returns:
        double the value of the clustering i.e. the MSSC value of the optimal asgnmnt of numbers in the sequence to be clustered to clusters.
        Throws:
        CException

      • solveDP2

        public double solveDP2()
                throws CException
        this method is the same as solveDP() except the (i,k) loop runs vertically instead of horizontally so that memory is saved Thus the outer loop is k, the inner loop is i
        Returns:
        double
        Throws:
        CException

      • solveDP2Parallel

        public double solveDP2Parallel(int numthreads)
                        throws CException
        this method is the same as solveDP2() except we use numthreads threads to run the inner vertical loop for the i=n-2...0 computing the k-th column values.
        Parameters:
        numthreads - int
        Returns:
        double
        Throws:
        CException

      • solveDP2ParallelMat

        public double solveDP2ParallelMat(int numthreads)
                           throws CException
        this method is the same as solveDP2Parallel() using numthreads threads to run the inner vertical loop for the i=n-2...0 computing the k-th column values. It also doesn't use ClusterSets, and so it's much faster.
        Parameters:
        numthreads - int
        Returns:
        double
        Throws:
        CException

      • solveDPMat

        public double solveDPMat()
                  throws CException
        this method is the same as solveDP() except it doesn't use ClusterSets. It is much faster.
        Returns:
        double
        Throws:
        CException

      • makeAllClusters

        private ClusterSet makeAllClusters()
                            throws CException
        has same purpose as makeAllClustersMatrix(p), but uses Cluster and ClusterSet objects which it returns.
        Returns:

        Throws:

      • makeAllClustersMatrix

        private double[][] makeAllClustersMatrix(Params p)
        return the matrix of dimensions n X n where [i,j] denotes the cost of the cluster containing the contiguous values of indices [i, i+1, ..., j]. Unfortunately, for the L1 (manhattan) norm, this computation has O(n^3) complexity, but for the L2 (Euclidean) norm, the computation reduces to O(n^2) complexity, allowing the overall MSSC1D DP-algorithm based on DP to achieve complexity O(kn^2/E) where k is the number of clusters sought and E the number of available processing units.
        Parameters:
        p - Params
        Returns:
        double[][]

      • makeAllClustersMatrix_L2

        private double[][] makeAllClustersMatrix_L2(Params p)
        return the matrix of dimensions n X n where [i,j] denotes the cost of the cluster containing the contiguous values of indices [i, i+1, ..., j] computed for L2 norm, only, allowing the overall MSSC1D DP-algorithm based on DP to achieve complexity O(kn^2/E) where k is the number of clusters sought and E the number of available processing units.
        Parameters:
        p - Params
        Returns:
        double[][]

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        test the cost-matrix creation for the L2 norm. Invoke as java -cp <classpath> popt4jlib.MSSC1D.Solver <file_name> <n>.
        Parameters:
        args - String[]
